page.title: 05School
page.content: There is a primary school in the village for children between 5 years and 11 years of age. The school is housed in th building which was built in 1437 as a Grammar school. Children not old enough to be admitted to te primary school are catered for by a playgroup run by mothers. These children attend for mornings only and use the villge hall were they may play safely under the supervision of the helpers.Older children leave the primary school and begin secondary education after their eleventh birthday. Ewelme children normally attend the school at Watlington, just over three miles away from the village. They are taken to school in specially chartered buses.
